item.title: Friends pay tribute to Canadian Piper James after her death at K'gari beach
item.description: Friends of 19-year-old Canadian woman Piper James pay tribute to a woman who loved adventure and nature.

item.title: Vietnamese gen Zs reclaim forebears' exploitative history of garment outwork
item.description: Jennifer Kiều Anh Doan's boutique's focus on independent Vietnamese fashioners is subverting her forebears' experience as exploited garment "outworkers".

item.title: Perth financial advisor Anthony Paul Torre jailed for taking more than $1 million from clients
item.description: Victims of a Perth financial adviser jailed for misappropriating more than a million dollars from investors say his six-year jail term is not enough.

item.title: Forbes man Lawrence Wilfred Norris intends to plead not guilty to historical child sex offences
item.description: A NSW court hears the former vice-president of a local show society intends to plead not guilty to dozens of historical child sexual assault charges if he is found fit to stand trial.

item.title: Australia's anti-slavery commissioner asks Tony Burke for visa reform after inquest into Jerwin Royupa's death
item.description: Australia's anti-slavery commissioner has written to Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke asking for reform on the 407 training visa, following the inquest into the death of Jerwin Royupa.

item.title: Geraldton man found floating off coast after WA police discover empty boat
item.description: Geraldton police find 61-year-old Kenneth Robinson in the water near Chapman Bay after they discovered his boat unoccupied this morning.

item.title: Two women and man killed in shooting in NSW town, gunman at large
item.description: Three people have been shot dead in the Central West town of Lake Cargelligo, with the gunman still at large.

item.title: St Vincent's Hospital charged over 2024 death of Makalie Watts-Owen
item.description: Makalie Watts-Owen died by suicide while admitted to St Vincent's Hospital's mental health unit, a month before her 24th birthday.

item.title: City of Perth probe lays bare workplace 'crisis', erosion of trust between Mayor and CEO
item.description: The City of Perth has rapidly descended into a workplace of psychological harm, according to a secret report obtained by the ABC.

item.title: From Bone Temple to Oscar hopefuls, here are January's best movies
item.description: Multiple Oscar hopefuls are finally hitting Australian shores this month, as well as the return of zombie franchise 28 Years Later.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: First LNG cargo from Santos Barossa gas project bound from Darwin to Japan
item.description: After a series of delays, Santos announces the first gas from its $5.6 billion Barossa project will be shipped from Darwin bound for Japan.

item.title: Maddison Inglis wins epic Australian Open second-round match
item.description: With a 10-point tiebreaker to decide her Australian Open fate, Maddison Inglis knew there was only one avenue to victory.

item.title: Albanese apologies for Bondi Beach terror deaths
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Naomi Osaka apologises for 'disrespectful' post-match comments aimed at Sorana Cirstea after tense Australian Open exchange
item.description: Naomi Osaka walks back her aggressive retort to a tense handshake between her and second-round opponent Sorana Cirstea.

item.title: Oscars 2026: Sinners break record with nominations, Jacob Elordi and Rose Byrne receive nods
item.description: Vampire film Sinners broke the Academy Award record for nominations with 16, while Rose Byrne was recognised for If I had Legs I'd Kick You and Jacob Elordi got a nod for his role in Frankenstein.

item.title: Climate change increased the chance of intense Australian heatwave fivefold, study finds
item.description: A study by World Weather Attribution has analysed temperatures during the intense early January heatwave. It found that what was once a rare event is now happening far more often.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A political break-up, a fashionable entrance and Macron's aviators
item.description: Another week, another quiz. Are you ready to test yourself?

item.title: The Nationals split shows the foundations of right-wing politics are shifting
item.description: It is impossible to view this week’s events without the broader context of the relationship between the Liberals and the Nationals, how the electoral map is changing and what that means for right-wing politics in Australia.

item.title: Questioning your relationship in the new year? You're not alone
item.description: The fresh start of a new year causes us to reassess many parts of our lives, including relationships. Knowing whether it's time to call it quits or give things more time requires reflection — and support — as our experts explain.

item.title: Australia names second-largest Winter Olympic team in history for 2026 Milan-Cortina Games
item.description: From five teenagers making their Winter Olympics debut to five-time Olympian and gold medal hopeful Scott James, Australia has named its second-largest team in history for the Milan-Cortina Games.

item.title: Anger and confusion after Australian courier Sendle collapses
item.description: The Australian company's customers feel like they have been "ghosted", while investors and shareholders are angry and confused about what happens next.

item.title: Seven-day heatwave to engulf south-east states, raising bushfire danger
item.description: South-east states are predicted to bake through a prolonged severe heatwave from Saturday onwards, which has the potential to break all-time temperature records and fuel another round of dangerous bushfires.

item.title: Fiji police allegedly seize $780m cocaine shipment in drug operation targeting Pacific Ocean 'narco sub'
item.description: Fijian chiefs reported suspicious activity along their stretch of coastline to law enforcement agencies — which then swooped on an alleged $780 million drug operation.

item.title: Daylesford op shop may permanently close after donation causes bed bug infestation
item.description: The future of a Victorian op shop is in doubt after a worker opened a bag containing the stuff of nightmares, leading to the destruction of stock and hefty cleaning bills that may prove to be a deadly financial blow.

item.title: Gunman wanted over triple shooting could be difficult to find, police say
item.description: Police have warned residents in villages neighbouring Lake Cargelligo to remain vigilant after three people were shot dead in a domestic violence attack on Thursday.

item.title: David Speirs not entitled to public campaign funding, electoral commission says
item.description: Former opposition leader David Speirs would "not fulfil the nomination requirements" if he applied to be a candidate at the upcoming state election, the state's electoral commission says, raising significant doubts about his chances of a political comeback.

item.title: Solid start to AI camera trial with rock fisher rescue at one of NSW's deadliest locations
item.description: Surf Life Saving NSW says the successful rescue of a rock fisher at Kiama Blowhole using two AI-enabled surveillance cameras proves the technology works.

item.title: triple j's Hottest 100 of 2025 — when it happens, how to listen and more
item.description: Australia's favourite music poll is back for another year — here's when it happens and how to listen.

item.title: Former childcare worker sentenced to community service after pleading guilty to assaulting five-year-old
item.description: A former Queensland childcare worker who dunked a child in a "muddy" puddle, causing him to hit a toy and injure his face, has been sentenced to 100 hours of community service.

item.title: Wawrinka's post-match recovery beer and an 'elite coffee snob' — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Madison Keys praises Melbourne coffee, Stan Wawrinka says he deserves a beer and Nick Kyrgios back to racquet throwing ways. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Homeschool 'drop-off' groups are booming but some say they are unregulated
item.description: Education experts say homeschooling's exploding popularity has sparked a growing market of "drop-off" groups.

item.title: DNA found in an ancient Colombian skeleton may hold answers to origin of syphilis
item.description: A previously unknown strain of syphilis bacteria has been discovered in human remains in Colombia, dating back 5,500 years.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis lose first round Australian Open men's doubles clash
item.description: After playing like "shadows of our former selves", Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis are out of the Australian Open men's doubles and into an uncertain future.

item.title: ASX slightly up, Aussie dollar hits 15-month high — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market has finished slightly higher after a rally on Wall Street, as investors showed signs of relief a day after US President Donald Trump dropped tariff threats against eight European countries. Look back on our Friday business blog.

item.title: Woman sentenced for illegal use of pepper spray as NT government looks to make laws permanent
item.description: A Darwin woman is handed a community corrections order for attacking someone with OC spray in a nightclub fight just weeks after the Northern Territory government announced a 12-month trial of the product.

item.title: How cool rooms and cold storage work to keep fruit fresh year-round
item.description: Apples only grow for three months of the year — but thanks to an ancient technique, that doesn't stop us grabbing one from the grocery store year round.

item.title: Defiant Sussan Ley downplays Nationals' split, vows to remain leader
item.description: The Liberal leader did not speak about the Nationals' decision to terminate the Coalition on yesterday's National Day of Mourning, but on Friday insisted her focus was on the government.

item.title: Japan's demand for Australian table grapes drives export growth
item.description: A rise in demand is making it feasible for some Australian grapes to be on sale in South-East Asia within 48 hours of being dispatched.

item.title: Canberra woman to face court after allegedly assaulting airline crew member on flight to Perth
item.description: Police say the 52-year-old woman "forcibly grabbed the arm and head" of a crew member, causing them minor injuries, as the plane was preparing to take off from Canberra on December 13.

item.title: Oscar nominations 2026: All the snubs, successes and surprises
item.description: Hybrid horror Sinners came up as the big winner in the 98th Academy Award nominations, with Aussie actors also eyeing up gold, and Wicked: For Good wiped off the map.

item.title: De Minaur powers through with straight-sets win over Tiafoe
item.description: Alex de Minaur defeats American Frances Tiafoe in straight sets on Rod Laver Arena after Yulia Putintseva mocks Turkish fans after knocking out qualifier Zeynep Sönmez.

item.title: Taylor Fritz pays tribute to 40-year-old Stan Wawrinka ahead of Australian Open match
item.description: It was meant as a compliment, rather than a show of disrespect, when Taylor Fritz answered a question about Australian Open rival Stan Wawrinka's age.

item.title: 1,000 cakes and eight complaints: Brisbane picnic event under investigation
item.description: An investigation has been launched into a viral Brisbane 'cake swap' event after attendees raised concerns over food safety and hygiene, with cakes reportedly left uncovered in hot weather for hours.

item.title: ICE officers detain five-year-old Minnesota boy as he arrives home from preschool
item.description: School officials and the family's lawyer say the boy and his father were taken to a detention facility in Texas, making the boy the fourth student from Minneapolis detained by immigration officers in recent weeks.

item.title: Man allegedly doused Gungahlin Police Station foyer in petrol and lit fire
item.description: Police allege the man entered the station with a jerry can, poured petrol onto the floor and lit it on fire.

item.title: Illegal dumping creates eyesore and hard work at Sunshine Coast op shops
item.description: Volunteers say they are tired of "lazy" residents dumping their unwanted goods outside op shops to avoid paying tip fees.

item.title: Lanlan Yang admits to breach of bail after Rolls-Royce crash in Sydney's east
item.description: The 23-year-old has sparked curiosity and intrigue among Chinese Australians due to her apparent wealth.

item.title: Paris Hilton brings sex tape story to Washington for AI deepfake porn fight
item.description: The party girl turned anti-abuse advocate throws her glamorous celebrity heft behind a push to tackle deepfake pornography.

item.title: Cyclone warning extended as tropical low edges closer to Kimberley coast
item.description: A tropical cyclone warning has been issued for residents along the far north WA coast.

item.title: Interstate police reviewing use of force in Kumanjayi White's death in custody in Alice Springs
item.description: After resisting calls for an arms-length investigation, NT police are "facilitating" prosecutors' request for an independent review of the arresting officers' use of force.

item.title: US and China sign off on TikTok agreement to avoid ban
item.description: Social media giant TikTok reaches a deal for a new joint venture in the United States to avoid being banned for American users. The platform's Beijing-based parent company, ByteDance, will retain a 19.9 per cent stake in the company.

item.title: What Bernard Fanning and Ben Lee's Hottest 100 topping hits tell us about them in 2005
item.description: In 2005, Bernard Fanning and Ben Lee were very different men with very similar struggles.

item.title: Queensland brothers charged by Australian Federal Police
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Queensland brothers charged with child abuse material offences after US tip-off
item.description: Australian Federal Police investigators allege the men accessed child abuse material on social media platforms.

item.title: Letter sent to Lakemba Mosque threatening violence on Australia Day investigated by police
item.description: The note, seen by the ABC, incited violence against several groups, including Middle Eastern communities, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and a number of political figures from Labor, the Greens and "socialists" were also singled out.

item.title: Who is the Neo-Nazi who was booed at Hobart's March for Australia rally?
item.description: With the organisers of March for Australia rallies saying they "are in no way concerned by the presence" of members of the National Socialist Network, the ABC can confirm a Tasmanian man whose words were too extreme for many in the Hobart crowd is believed to be a leader within the state's Neo-Nazi movement.

item.title: Labor identity Tim Picton remembered at Perth Stadium memorial service
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is among political figures and business leaders who travel across the country to pay their respects to Mr Picton.

item.title: Federal Court finds extended Victoria Police stop-and-search declaration was unlawful and invalid
item.description: The Federal Court has found a Victoria Police move to give officers greater powers in Melbourne's CBD for six months was invalid and unlawful.

item.title: How to attract native wildlife and birds to your garden
item.description: There are simple things we can all do to encourage more native wildlife to our gardens, backyards, balconies and shared spaces.

item.title: Video of bull shark washed up on Brisbane River bank sparks debate over AI technology
item.description: A video posted to social media of a bull shark washed up in the Brisbane River went viral and prompted speculation that it was AI-generated, but experts say it appears to be legitimate.

item.title: Former Broome pub manager jailed for six years over rape of staff member
item.description: Stewart Patrick Burchell is jailed for six years, found guilty by jury trial of raping a staff member and indecently assaulting several others.

item.title: Sam Welsford wins Tour Down Under stage three, fears for riders with 42C temperatures Saturday
item.description: Sam Welsford claimed a brilliant Tour Down Under stage victory, the seventh of his career, as experts fear for riders ahead of 40-degree Celsius temperatures predicted for Saturday's fourth stage.

item.title: Lake Cargelligo residents in shock after three people shot dead
item.description: Residents of a remote NSW town of just 1,500 residents have expressed shock at a deadly shooting spree where three people were shot dead.

item.title: UK government says new passport rules designed with national security in mind
item.description: The requirement for dual British citizens to have a valid UK passport while entering the country would help prevent the arrival of people who present a threat, Australia's British High Commission says.

item.title: Friday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Yulia Putintseva taunts Zeynep Sönmez's Australian Open supporters
item.description: Kazakhstan's Yulia Putintseva happily plays the role of villain following her three-set win over Zeynep Sönmez at the Australian Open.

item.title: To Lam wins second term to rule Vietnam through 2030
item.description: Vietnam's leader To Lam has been re-appointed as head of the ruling Communist Party for the next five years, and pledges to turbocharge growth in the export-reliant nation.

item.title: Lawyers call for Australian investigation into Israeli President Isaac Herzog amid genocide allegations
item.description: The Australian Centre for International Justice has formally requested a police investigation into Israel's president for alleged incitement to genocide. He is expected to visit to Australia next month.

item.title: West Coast Eagles player Tyler Brockman charged with assault after Geraldton fracas
item.description: West Coast Eagles player Tyler Brockman is charged with causing grievous bodily harm following an incident in Geraldton in late December.

item.title: Fire threat means Tour Down Under stage four loses iconic Willunga Hill
item.description: Tomorrow's fourth stage of the Tour Down Under has been shortened due to local bushfire threats and forecast temperatures in excess of 40 degrees Celsius.

item.title: Jake Fenner sentenced to three years in prison over father's death in Darwin
item.description: Jake Fenner, 32, has been handed a partially suspended sentence for causing the death of his father at their Moil home in 2023.

item.title: Drowning most likely cause of death of Canadian backpacker Piper James on K'gari, coroner says
item.description: A preliminary report from the Coroners Court of Queensland finds that while Piper James was bitten by dingoes before she died on K'gari, drowning is the most likely cause of death.

item.title: Steve Smith delivers again as Sixers down Hurricanes to cruise into BBL decider
item.description: Steve Smith top scores for the fifth time in as many innings as the Sixers down the Hurricanes to book a place in Sunday's BBL decider in Perth.

item.title: Hottest 100 quiz: How well do you remember past countdowns?
item.description: While you wait to hear who is number one this year, test your memory of past Hottest 100 countdowns.

item.title: As Russia's war intensifies Europe is exploring military and economic independence
item.description: As the world's elite gathered in Davos, European leaders confronted a reality in which they might need to defend themselves, and potentially against, the United States.

item.title: From ultimatum to implosion: How the Coalition went its separate ways
item.description: Dissecting the implosion of the Coalition and figuring out what comes next has become a full-time vocation for the newly emancipated Liberals and Nationals.

item.title: Prince Harry takes on the Daily Mail in High Court privacy showdown
item.description: The Duke of Sussex takes on the publisher he believes poisoned his childhood, his marriage, and his peace of mind in a legal battle driven by anger as well as principle.

item.title: Search for Julian Ingram enters third day following Lake Cargelligo shooting
item.description: A gunman accused of killing three people and seriously injuring another in New South Wales' Central West may be receiving help to evade authorities, police say.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Luana forms into category one system off Kimberley coast
item.description: Residents in WA's West Kimberley are being warned to prepare for days of wild weather, with a tropical cyclone forming up off the region's coast.

item.title: Alex de Minaur driven to prove doubters wrong as Australian Open campaign continues
item.description: Alex de Minaur is back in familiar territory, on the cusp of the Australian Open quarterfinals, but he is adamant he can make a deeper run at Melbourne Park than his previous appearances.

item.title: Australia smash Sri Lanka by nine wickets to stay unbeaten at Under-19s Cricket World Cup
item.description: Australia have continued their dominant run through the Under-19s Cricket World Cup with Will Byrom's 5-14 leading the way in a nine-wicket win over Sri Lanka in their final group match.

item.title: Alex de Minaur's wedding confession and Yulia Putintseva plays the villain — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Alex de Minaur has some thoughts on his upcoming wedding with Katie Boulter, while Yulia Putintseva plays the villain on day six. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Australian Neo-Nazis use symbols that may evade hate speech laws
item.description: Viking symbols and a Norwegian jacket have now become synonymous with Australia's Neo-Nazi groups, but what do they mean?

item.title: Track temperatures as heatwave sweeps across continent over Australia Day weekend
item.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

item.title: Inside Minnesota, Reverend Ashley Horan is helping people steer clear of ICE agents
item.description: Reverend Ashley Horan lives one block from where Renee Good was shot and killed and by ICE agents. She and her neighbours have been tracking ICE's movements around Minneapolis.

item.title: Worst crown-of-thorns starfish outbreak in decades emerging on Great Barrier Reef
item.description: Scientists are rushing to contain an emerging outbreak of coral-eating crown-of-thorns starfish on the Great Barrier Reef, warning it could be one of the worst in 60 years.

item.title: SA heatwave leads to total fire bans, catastrophic conditions and Tour Down Under changes
item.description: South Australia's hottest weather in six years creates dangerous bushfire conditions, which the head of the Country Fire Service says are "as serious as it gets".

item.title: Triggering a heatwave takes more than just temperature — as Australia braces for another
item.description: Yet another major heatwave is sweeping across south-eastern Australia. But what actually triggers the warning? Spoiler alert: hitting 40C is not enough.

item.title: Heatwave and fire warnings across south-east Australia as tropical cyclone hits WA
item.description: Parts of south-east Australia are enduring severe heatwaves with fire warnings in place over the long weekend, as the Bureau of Meteorology issues a tropical cyclone warning for Western Australia.

item.title: Majority of NSW beaches shut amid shark attacks to reopen for Australia Day long weekend
item.description: Heatwave conditions and Australia Day long weekend activities are expected to draw crowds back to the water after a dangerous 48 hours on the New South Wales coast.

item.title: Ross River Virus cases quadruple in South Australia in 2025
item.description: There were more than four times the number of Ross River Virus cases in South Australia in 2025 compared to 2024, prompting a new public health awareness campaign.

item.title: How a tank of zebrafish helped two children born with a rare genetic variant
item.description: With a tank of zebrafish, Queensland researcher Jean Giacomotto was able to test a never-before seen genetic variant affecting two babies.

item.title: Future of Canberra's Black Mountain Tower in limbo as Ngunnawal cultural site plans stall
item.description: Custodians say they have been excluded from talks between Telstra and the ACT government about plans to develop the iconic tower into a Ngunnawal cultural site.

item.title: Gen Z led the revolution in Bangladesh — can they win the election?
item.description: After toppling Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh's newest political party faces its first election next month, testing a newly formed alliance.

item.title: Range Tennis Club in Toowoomba grows from 12 members to 600 in six years
item.description: A regional sports club bucks the national trend of declining membership in community sporting groups, serving up a love for the game of tennis that crosses generations.

item.title: Quick and easy pasta with a zesty, no-cook salsa sauce - ABC News
item.description: Salsa is not just for tacos. It's the perfect summer pasta sauce and makes the most of juicy summer tomatoes.

item.title: Chalamet getting fresh for an Oscar, or is his campaign a bit (ping) pongy?
item.description: Director Josh Safdie's debut solo film has been garnering accolades left and right but isn't quite lead actor Timothée Chalamet's finest work.

item.title: Play to start earlier at Australian Open as Melbourne braces for a heatwave
item.description: Play will start earlier on Saturday, with temperatures in Melbourne set to reach 40 degrees Celsius.

item.title: Aussie Inglis progresses as Osaka announces shock late withdrawal
item.description: Naomi Osaka withdraws from her match against Maddison Inglis shortly before it was due to be played, putting the Australian into the fourth round.

item.description: Flannelette shirts might not be acceptable in every office, but after a lengthy discussion councillors in one NSW town will be allowed to wear them to meetings.

item.description: The man picked for one of the Northern Territory's most lucrative jobs — which comes with a manor overlooking Darwin Harbour — has drawn controversy before even walking through the gates.

item.title: WA government hopes new Perth Film Studios can become epicentre of Australia's screen industry
item.description: Perth's new film studio is almost ready to receive its first production. There’s just one problem – no one has signed up yet. Is that a sign of things to come from a facility the government has sunk millions into?

item.title: Olivia Dean takes out the #1 spot on the triple j Hottest 100 of 2025 — as it happened
item.description: After millions of votes from Australia and around the world, British artist Olivia Dean has topped the triple j Hottest 100 of 2025 with her song, Man I Need.

item.title: John Williamson takes his final bow at the Tamworth Country Music Festival
item.description: Aussie music legend John Williamson will take the Tamworth Country Music Festival stage for the last time as he steps into retirement.

item.description: Experts estimate 11,000 hectares of core habitat for the critically endangered parrot has been lost to a recent fire.

item.title: Socceroos receive major boost as Jackson Irvine returns from injury for St Pauli
item.description: In welcome news for Socceroos boss Tony Popovic, key Australian midfielder Jackson Irvine has made an early return from injury for St Pauli in the Bundesliga.

item.title: Inside the program getting more First Nations people into fire and rescue squads
item.description: For First Nations recruits the path to firefighting is demanding, competitive and often deeply personal.

item.title: Fortescue breaks ground on Pilbara's first wind farm in move to decarbonise
item.description: A mining company in Western Australia's Pilbara region is one step closer to decarbonising its iron ore production after starting construction on the region's first wind farm.

item.title: The Limestone Coast's Little Blue Lake drawing visitors over summer
item.description: While its younger brother gets much of the shine, the Little Blue Lake is a unique and ancient spectacle in SA's south east.

item.title: A generation of activists like Grace Oo are taking up arms against Myanmar's military
item.description: As Myanmar's military junta seeks international legitimacy through elections, its brutal repression of the pro-democracy movement is radicalising a new generation of activists.

item.title: Indra Brown wins X-Games silver on debut ahead of 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Indra Brown continued her extraordinary form heading into the 2026 Winter Olympics with a silver medal at the X-Games in Aspen.

item.title: US looks to South Korea to take 'primary responsibility' in monitoring Kim Jong Un and North Korea
item.description: The United States says it intends to play a "more limited" role in deterring nuclear-powered North Korea, shifting the burden of responsibility onto South Korea.

item.title: Nico Antic, 12yo boy attacked by shark at Sydney beach, dies in hospital
item.description: Nico Antic, the 12-year-old boy who suffered serious leg injuries after being bitten by a shark in Sydney's east has died in hospital.

item.description: Jay Vine loses two teammates on a blistering fourth stage of the Tour Down Under, but retains his overall lead as Ethan Vernon claimed the stage victory.

item.description: Piper James loved to start her days on K'gari by swimming alone at sunrise. Now her family is planning her final journey home.

item.title: Seven dead, 82 missing in Indonesia landslide, agency says, with search and rescue efforts ramped up
item.description: The landslide was reported in the West Bandung region of Indonesia's West Java province, according to the nation's agency spokesperson Abdul Muhari.

item.title: Corpse flower Smellanie at Adelaide Botanic Garden is blooming
item.description: Cheese, fermented cabbage, roadkill – these are how some people have described the smell emitting from a corpse flower that has finally bloomed at the Adelaide Botanic Garden.

item.description: Extreme heat protocols kick into gear at Melbourne Park, as the stifling weather conditions wreak havoc with the Australian Open tournament's schedule.

item.description: Tropical Cyclone Luana edges closer to the Kimberley town of Derby as a category one system.

item.description: Had the Australian Open's extreme heat protocols not taken effect, Janik Sinner wonders if he would still be in the tournament.

item.title: Hottest 100 of 2025 - featuring Playlunch, Olivia Dean, Tame Impala and RAYE
item.description: It's that time again, triple j has counted down the year's Hottest 100 songs as voted by the public, celebrating all the incredible music that soundtracked our lives in 2025.

item.title: Travel-weary Sydney Sixers aim to turn tables on Perth Scorchers in BBL decider
item.description: After a taxing, cross-continental travel journey to Sunday's BBL decider, the Sydney Sixers are set for one final push against the all-conquering Scorchers at Perth Stadium.

item.title: Naomi Osaka withdaws from Australian Open as Maddison Inglis reaches fourth round
item.description: Naomi Osaka pulls the pin on her Australian Open campaign, handing Maddison Inglis her first appearance in the fourth round at a major.

item.description: Russian attacks on Ukraine have killed at least one person and wounded 31, as negotiators from both countries and the US met for a second day of peace talks. The meetings ended without a deal.

item.description: Kasey Chambers wins three Golden Guitars in Tamworth, including Single and Song of the Year for a track she penned with her ex-husband Shane Nicholson.

item.title: After a horror week of shark attacks, how do we sift facts from fear?
item.description: As a devoted ocean swimmer, I've learned to accept the risk of exploring an ocean that is not my natural habitat.

item.title: Today in History, January 25: How Nirvana saved the first Big Day Out in 1992
item.description: How the first Big Day Out in 1992 turned a risky idea into a landmark moment in Australian music history.

item.title: Nine self-harm hospitalisations in 12 months after new NT youth justice centre opened
item.description: Nine youths ended up in hospital after self-harming at Darwin's new $130 million detention centre in the 12 months after it opened, documents released to the ABC under Freedom of Information laws have revealed.

item.title: From truth-telling to closing the gap, First Nations leaders outline their priorities in 2026
item.description: Ahead of the national debate around Indigenous rights and recognition this January 26, the ABC has spoken to First Nations leaders about what they think are the top priorities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

item.title: Liberals wait on Hastie-Taylor decision before challenging Sussan Ley's leadership
item.description: Liberal leadership aspirants Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor are being urged to "sort out" which of them will challenge Sussan Ley for the party's top job before a spill is called.

item.description: Novak Djokovic shows once again that his relationship with Australian tennis fans is as complicated as it gets, turning a routine win into a full-blown drama.

item.title: Stan Wawrinka says goodbye with a beer as Jannik Sinner is saved by the sun — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Stan Wawrinka bowed out from the Australian Open with a tear in his eye and a beer in his hand, while a grumpy Novak Djokovic set an incredible new benchmark. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Former state care kid calls for fundamental change to fix 'broken' residential care system
item.description: Residential care is often a last resort for society's most vulnerable children, but being raised by a "system" can leave both physical and emotional scars. It's why those who have gone through it are asking for their voices to be included to reform it.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Will this be the week you nail it? Nah, probably not
item.description: I applaud your repeated attempts to do well at this quiz. Will your desperation pay off?

item.title: Australia warned recovering Chinese tourism market may cool in 2026
item.description: Chinese visitor numbers have increased but are still below pre-pandemic levels, with economists warning ongoing economic uncertainty in China could dampen long-haul travel.

item.title: Australia Day event Aus Lights on the River cancelled in Adelaide
item.description: An annual Australia Day event in the Adelaide CBD has been cancelled ahead of potentially the hottest day in six years.

item.title: Sydney volunteers break barriers to music, sports events for disability community
item.description: For some, going to a music gig or sporting event alone can be daunting, but a Sydney volunteer program is empowering people with a disability to get out of their comfort zone.

item.title: Out-of-control bushfire in Victoria's Otways grows as state faces record temperatures on Tuesday
item.description: An out-of-control bushfire has threatened communities in Victoria's Otways, as heatwave conditions continue in some parts of the state.

item.title: New residents purchase real estate in Barcaldine, attracted by affordable prices
item.description: From retirees to first home buyers, people are making the most of affordable housing in this outback town.

item.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Luana downgraded to tropical low after impacting Dampier Peninsula
item.description: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Luana is downgraded to a tropical low as it continues inland after crossing the northern WA coast.

item.title: Mother shares tribute to 15-year-old Max trapped under Mount Maunganui landslide
item.description: After two days of holding out hope despite all the odds, the local police superintendent had the heart-wrenching job of announcing that no-one trapped by the landslide at Mount Maunganui could have survived.

item.title: Former Japanese PM Shinzo Abe's killer motivated by 'disgust' at links to Unification Church
item.description: The man who killed former Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe thought it was his life's mission to destroy a controversial church.

item.title: Young victim-survivors say 'shameful' Victorian family violence response causes harm
item.description: Young Victorian victim-survivors of family violence say the state government must prioritise their needs so they can leave violent homes.

item.title: Police chief calls for calm after man killed during Minneapolis immigration crackdown
item.description: This is the second fatal shooting involving federal agents this month during a surge in immigration enforcement in the northern US city.

item.title: Rod Laver’s father built him a backyard tennis court 80 years ago. Now locals are battling to save it
item.description: Like Donald Bradman’s tank stand, the backyard tennis court of Rod Laver’s youth has survived against the odds, but it is yet to be heritage listed.

item.title: Meet the change makers nominated to be 2026 Australian of the Year
item.description: Life-saving underwater amputations, decades of healthcare in refugee camps and fundraising campaigns for Australia's first astronaut – these are just a few of the achievements of the 2026 crop of Australian of the Year nominees.

item.title: Searching for Celine: How YouTube filmmaker Rob Parsons helped the search for missing tourist Celine Cremer
item.description: Rob Parsons amassed a following on YouTube for his videos of remote gold panning and mineral fossicking. Now, his attention is on the search for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer.

item.title: Moment federal officers shoot man dead in Minneapolis
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Kondoli Dreaming brings Ramindjeri and Ngarrindjeri knowledge to firefighting
item.description: A new fire response vehicle in South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula has been named after a Dreaming story about a powerful whale man that explores the creation of fire, paying homage to tens of thousands of years of local fire management knowledge.

item.title: Iranian protesters chant for a 'revolution' after years of economic chaos
item.description: Decades of economic mismanagement and government corruption have widened wealth gaps in Iran, leaving ordinary Iranians calling for a revolution.

item.title: How moving overseas changed my shopping habits
item.description: Amid all the adventure and growth, I've noticed a surprisingly quiet shift I didn't expect: my relationship with shopping.

item.title: People involved in Runt movie grappling with how to feel after author Craig Silvey charged
item.description: As one of Australia's most renowned authors faces child exploitation material charges, the town where one of his children's books was turned into a motion picture is grappling with the news.

item.title: PM says Trump's insult to troops 'not acceptable', as he names Greg Moriarty next ambassador to the US
item.description: Defence department boss Greg Moriarty is named the next ambassador to the United States, as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese criticises the US president's claim that allied troops did not serve on the front lines of Afghanistan.

item.title: Protests erupt after second deadly shooting by federal agents in Minneapolis
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Australia's most popular baby names from 2025 revealed
item.description: Abbey wanted a traditional, feminine name for her newborn daughter that would convey strength. Unwittingly, she chose one of the most popular baby names in Australia from 2025.

item.title: Bangladesh officially withdraws from T20 World Cup as Scotland wins last-minute call-up
item.description: After weeks of uncertainty, Bangladesh officially withdraws from next month's T20 World Cup due to security concerns, with Scotland called in for the tournament.

item.title: Live: De Minaur demolishes Bublik to storm into quarterfinal date with Alcaraz
item.description: Alex de Minaur obliterates Alexander Bublik in straight sets on Rod Laver Arena, after superstars Aryna Sabalenka and Carlos Alcaraz progressed through to the last eight of the Australian Open. Follow live.

item.title: Why easing demand for illegal cigarettes will be a win-win situation for WA government
item.description: Much has been made of how the WA government is trying to stop the supply of illegal cigarettes, but its more difficult challenge is what can be done to ease demand.

item.title: Prince Harry takes the Daily Mail to the High Court, but some say the result will be a judgement on him
item.description: This week, Prince Harry traded the sunny West Coast for London to give evidence in a "super claim" against the publishers of the Daily Mail and the Mail on Sunday, Associated Newspapers.

item.title: British dual citizen shares concerns about middleman websites overcharging for passport renewals
item.description: As many British-Australian dual nationals grapple with new entry requirements, experts warn of exploitative and middleman websites.

item.title: Health warning issued as Melbourne blanketed in smoke from Otways fire
item.description: A health warning was issued to Melbourne residents as the city was covered in smoke from a bushfire burning in the Otways, in Victoria's south-west.

item.title: Chinese military's top general investigated for 'suspected serious violations of discipline' as purge targets officials
item.description: Rumours of a probe swirled last week after military officials Zhang Youxia and Liu Zhenli appeared to miss a meeting chaired by Xi Jinping.

item.title: Sharn Davidson is living with Tourette syndrome and uses dinosaurs to educate others about differences
item.description: Sharn has two dinosaurs inside her — one is called Kevin and the other Terry. Here's how she handles it when they roar unexpectedly.

item.title: Donald Trump praises UK troops as 'brave' warriors after widespread condemnation
item.description: The US President has praised British soldiers, after remarks he made earlier this week about NATO troops in Afghanistan were described as "insulting and appalling" by the UK's Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

item.title: Queensland family trades cattle breeding for steak searing
item.description: A Queensland family is trading decades of purebred cattle breeding for life in the kitchen, selling off 20 years of stud work to focus on a new paddock-to-plate restaurant.

item.title: Police confirm possible sighting of Julian Ingram in Mount Hope after Lake Cargelligo shooting
item.description: A large-scale search is underway in the Mount Hope district after a possible sighting of the alleged triple murderer overnight.

item.title: US snowstorm triggers thousands of flight cancellations and power outages
item.description: A monster snowstorm is moving across the US, cancelling thousands of flights, knocking out power and snarling major roadways with ice.

item.description: Queensland government officials euthanase six dingoes involved in the death of a Canadian backpacker on K'gari, with more to be put down in the coming days.

item.title: Last-ditch push to land hospital and NDIS funding deal, as states fight back
item.description: The Commonwealth will try to force a deal on hospital funding at a National Cabinet meeting this week, after months of stalled negotiations with angry state leaders, who say the federal government is not contributing its fair share.

item.title: What makes a house a home? Kevin McCloud and Tim Ross might have the answer
item.description: What makes a house a home? Grand Designs' Kevin McCloud and design enthusiast Tim Ross say it's as simple as a building that "puts you in contact with other people".

item.title: American rock climber Alex Honnold reaches top of Taipei 101 skyscraper without ropes
item.description: It took Alex Honnold about 90 minutes to reach the top of the 508-metre-tall building.

item.title: New era dawns in Australian cricket as Big Bash generation steps up
item.description: While Australian punters and pundits alike have been wringing their hands over an aging national cricket squad, the next generation has been quietly getting to work, proving they are ready to fill the shoes of retiring stars.

item.title: Bull shark tagging and extra drones for NSW beaches following attacks
item.description: NSW coast and Sydney Harbour beachgoers can expect to see more drones in the sky after a $4.2 million investment into the state's shark management program in the wake of four shark attacks, including one fatal.

item.title: Australian Open favourite Aryna Sabalenka's simple approach to being world number one
item.description: As another Australian Open title beckons, Aryna Sabalenka reveals why she has not changed since topping the world rankings.

item.description: Scotty James has matched snowboard legend Shaun White by claiming his eighth superpipe gold medal at the X-Games Aspen 2026, making him a sure favourite for Olympic gold in Milano Cortina next month.

item.title: Kangaroo takes out Tour Down Under peloton, Jay Vine claims overall victory
item.description: Jay Vine was taken out by a pair of kangaroos and lost yet another teammate to injury, but was still able to hang on and claim a second career Tour Down Under victory.
